QuestionStatement: If marginal business tax rates are decreased, how will aggregate supply and employment change in the long run?
AnswerChoices: See above
See above
See above
See above
See above

QuestionStatement: Which of the following would cause the official unemployment rate to understate the problem of unemployment?
AnswerChoices: Workers receiving unemployment compensation
Cyclically unemployed workers
Discouraged workers
Recent college graduates looking for work
Retirees

QuestionStatement: Which of the following actions by the Federal Reserve reduces the ability of the banking system to create money?
AnswerChoices: Decreasing the federal funds rate
Decreasing the discount rate
Increasing the money supply
Increasing the reserve requirement
Buying government bonds on the open market

QuestionStatement: An increase in the international value of the United States dollar will tend to cause
AnswerChoices: United States exports to fall
The national income of the United States to increase
Employment in the manufacturing sector of the United States to increase
The inflation rate in the United States to increase
The growth rate of the United States economy to increase

QuestionStatement: Which of the following statements about the simple circular flow model of a market economy is correct?
AnswerChoices: Households are on the demand side of the product market and the supply side of the resource market
Business firms are on the supply side of both the product market and the resource market
Households receive income in the form of wages, and business firms receive income in the form of investment
Exports and investment expenditures are examples of leakage from the circular flow, whereas imports and savings are injections
Circular flow models are used primarily to explain why the money is necessary in any economic system

QuestionStatement: Which of the following government policies can reduce the rate of inflation in the short run?
AnswerChoices: Providing investment tax credits for businesses
Reducing personal income tax rates
Selling bonds on the open market
Decreasing the reserve requirement
Decreasing the discount rate

QuestionStatement: Crowding out occurs when
AnswerChoices: Increases in government spending become ineffective because tax revenues increase as income increases
Government borrowing to finance its spending decreases private sector investment
Monetary policy actions decrease the effectiveness of fiscal policy
Restrictive monetary policy causes the interest rate to increase
Government spending and private sector spending increase by the same percentage rate

QuestionStatement: Which of the following is true of a horizontal aggregate supply curve?
AnswerChoices: It is the usual assumption made by classical economists analyzing the long run
It suggests that increases in output can occur without increases in price levels
It suggests that a shift in the aggregate demand curve will lead to a change in the price level
It is likely to occur only in highly industrialized economies
It cannot shift, therefore output remains constant

QuestionStatement: Which of the following individuals is classified as unemployed?
AnswerChoices: A fifteen year old high school student who is looking for a babysitting job
A laid off computer programmer who has given up looking for a new job
A parent who works in an after-school day care center for 15 hours a week
A recent college graduate who is looking for her first job
A mayor who lost an election and retired

QuestionStatement: If an effective price floor is removed from a market for a good, then the price and quantity of the good sold will change in which of the following ways?
AnswerChoices: See above
See above
See above
See above
See above

QuestionStatement: When the Federal Reserve increases the money supply to stimulate aggregate demand, workers believe that this action will cause inflation in the future and ask for higher wages to offset the expected increase in inflation.  This is an example of
AnswerChoices: Adaptive expectations
Rational expectations
The velocity of money
The real balance effect
The money multiplier

QuestionStatement: Which of the following would be included as a liability on a commercial bank’s balance sheet?
AnswerChoices: Consumer loans
Demand deposits
Net worth
Bank reserves
Treasury bonds

QuestionStatement: Which of the following statements best describes the impact of a decrease in Japanese income on aggregate demand in the United States?
AnswerChoices: There will be no change in aggregate demand because United States aggregate demand depends only on the income of the United States consumers
Aggregate demand will decrease because the demand for United States exports decreases
Aggregate demand will decrease because the value of the United States dollar decreases relative to the Japanese yen
Aggregate demand will increase because a decrease in income in Japan causes an increase in income in the United States
Aggregate demand will increase because interest rates in the United States decrease

QuestionStatement: Suppose that the Federal Reserve is committed to keeping the nominal interest rate fixed.  To maintain the interest rate target in the face of expansionary fiscal policy, the Federal Reserve can do which of the following?
AnswerChoices: Increase the prime rate
Increase the discount rate
Increase the federal funds market
Engage in open-market purchases
Engage in open market sales

QuestionStatement: Which of the following is true of the quantity of money demanded?
AnswerChoices: It rises when interest rates rise, because the return from holding money increases
It falls when interest rates rise, because the opportunity cost of holding money increases
It remains constant when interest rates rise, as long as inflation remains constant
It rises when interest rates rise, as long as inflation is declining
It falls when the money supply increases, as long as inflation remains constant

QuestionStatement: Which of the following would be a current account transaction?
AnswerChoices: India buys $10 billion of new United States treasury bonds
A United States firm buys 5 percent of the stock of another United States firm
A United States firm builds a new factory in Kenya
A United States firm sells $500 million of its products to a Chinese company
The United States buys $8 billion worth of Euros

QuestionStatement: Which of the following will most likely occur if a government adopts an annually balanced budget rule that requires the government to eliminate any deficits or surpluses?
AnswerChoices: Unemployment will be eliminated and prices will be stable
The national debt will increase
Business cycles will become more stable
The automatic stabilizing effect of fiscal policy will be eliminated
The government will be forced to spend less when there are surpluses

QuestionStatement: Which of the following changes would cause an economy’s aggregate demand curve to shift to the right?
AnswerChoices: An increase in spending on imports
An increase in autonomous consumption spending
An increase in interest rates
A decrease in the money supply
A decrease in the overall price level in the economy

QuestionStatement: In the measurement of gross domestic product, investment includes spending by
AnswerChoices: Businesses on capital goods and changes in inventories
Businesses on stocks, bonds, and other financial assets
Individual households on stocks, bonds, and other financial assets
The federal government to purchase bonds issued by the Federal Reserve
The Federal Reserve to buy government bonds

QuestionStatement: Which of the following statements concerning economic growth is true?
AnswerChoices: If the population is growing faster than potential output, real gross domestic product per capita will definitely increase
With long-run economic growth, there is an increase in aggregate supply
The gap between rich and poor must widen with long-run economic growth
Increasing potential output necessarily increases the economic welfare of the average citizen
Long-run economic growth is possible with demand management policies
